verses.text: Now it came to pass in the \w days|strong="H3117"\w* of \w Ahasuerus|strong="H0325"\w*, (this \add is\add* \w Ahasuerus|strong="H0325"\w* which \w reigned|strong="H4427"\w*, from \w India|strong="H1912"\w* even unto \w Ethiopia|strong="H3568"\w*, \add over\add* an \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* and \w seven|strong="H7651"\w* and \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w* \w provinces|strong="H4082"\w*:)

\add That\add* in those \w days|strong="H3117"\w*, when the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w Ahasuerus|strong="H0325"\w* \w sat|strong="H3427"\w* on the \w throne|strong="H3678"\w* of his \w kingdom|strong="H4438"\w*, which \add was\add* in \w Shushan|strong="H7800"\w* the \w palace|strong="H1002"\w*,

In the \w third|strong="H7969"\w* \w year|strong="H8141"\w* of his \w reign|strong="H4427"\w*, he \w made|strong="H6213"\w* a \w feast|strong="H4960"\w* unto all his \w princes|strong="H8269"\w* and his \w servants|strong="H5650"\w*; the \w power|strong="H2428"\w* of \w Persia|strong="H6539"\w* and \w Media|strong="H4074"\w*, the \w nobles|strong="H6579"\w* and \w princes|strong="H8269"\w* of the \w provinces|strong="H4082"\w*, \add being\add* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* him:

When he \w shewed|strong="H7200"\w* the \w riches|strong="H6239"\w* of his \w glorious|strong="H3519"\w* \w kingdom|strong="H4438"\w* and the \w honour|strong="H3366"\w* of his \w excellent|strong="H8597"\w* \w majesty|strong="H1420"\w* \w many|strong="H7227"\w* \w days|strong="H3117"\w*, \add even\add* an \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* and \w fourscore|strong="H8084"\w* \w days|strong="H3117"\w*.

And when these \w days|strong="H3117"\w* were \w expired|strong="H4390"\w*, the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w made|strong="H6213"\w* a \w feast|strong="H4960"\w* unto all the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* that were \w present|strong="H4672"\w* in \w Shushan|strong="H7800"\w* the \w palace|strong="H1002"\w*, both unto \w great|strong="H1419"\w* and \w small|strong="H6996"\w*, \w seven|strong="H7651"\w* \w days|strong="H3117"\w*, in the \w court|strong="H2691"\w* of the \w garden|strong="H1594"\w* of the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w palace|strong="H1055"\w*;\f + \fr 1.5 \ft present: Heb. found\f*

\add Where were\add* \w white|strong="H2353"\w*, \w green|strong="H3768"\w*, and \w blue|strong="H8504"\w*, \add hangings\add*, \w fastened|strong="H0270"\w* with \w cords|strong="H2256"\w* of fine \w linen|strong="H0948"\w* and \w purple|strong="H0713"\w* to \w silver|strong="H3701"\w* \w rings|strong="H1550"\w* and \w pillars|strong="H5982"\w* of \w marble|strong="H8336"\w*: the \w beds|strong="H4296"\w* \add were of\add* \w gold|strong="H2091"\w* and \w silver|strong="H3701"\w*, upon a \w pavement|strong="H7531"\w* of \w red|strong="H0923"\w*, and \w blue|strong="H8504"\w*, and \w white|strong="H1858"\w*, and \w black|strong="H5508"\w*, \w marble|strong="H8336"\w*.\f + \fr 1.6 \ft blue, hangings: or, violet, etc\f*\f + \fr 1.6 \ft of red…: or, of porphyre, and marble and alabaster, and stone of blue colour\f*

And they gave \add them\add* \w drink|strong="H8248"\w* in \w vessels|strong="H3627"\w* of \w gold|strong="H2091"\w*, (the \w vessels|strong="H3627"\w* being \w diverse|strong="H8138"\w* one from \w another|strong="H3627"\w*,) and \w royal|strong="H4438"\w* \w wine|strong="H3196"\w* in \w abundance|strong="H7227"\w*, according to the \w state|strong="H3027"\w* of the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*.\f + \fr 1.7 \ft royal…: Heb. wine of the kingdom\f*\f + \fr 1.7 \ft state: Heb. hand\f*

And the \w drinking|strong="H8360"\w* \add was\add* according to the \w law|strong="H1881"\w*; none did \w compel|strong="H0597"\w*: for so the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* had \w appointed|strong="H3245"\w* to all the \w officers|strong="H7227"\w* of his \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, that they should \w do|strong="H6213"\w* according to every \w man’s|strong="H0376"\w* \w pleasure|strong="H7522"\w*.

Also \w Vashti|strong="H2060"\w* the \w queen|strong="H4436"\w* \w made|strong="H6213"\w* a \w feast|strong="H4960"\w* for the \w women|strong="H0802"\w* \add in\add* the \w royal|strong="H4438"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w* which \add belonged\add* to \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w Ahasuerus|strong="H0325"\w*.

¶ On the \w seventh|strong="H7637"\w* \w day|strong="H3117"\w*, when the \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* of the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* was \w merry|strong="H2896"\w* with \w wine|strong="H3196"\w*, he \w commanded|strong="H0559"\w* \w Mehuman|strong="H4104"\w*, \w Biztha|strong="H0968"\w*, \w Harbona|strong="H2726"\w*, \w Bigtha|strong="H0903"\w*, and \w Abagtha|strong="H0005"\w*, \w Zethar|strong="H2242"\w*, and \w Carcas|strong="H3752"\w*, the \w seven|strong="H7651"\w* \w chamberlains|strong="H5631"\w* that \w served|strong="H8334"\w* in the \w presence|strong="H6440"\w* of \w Ahasuerus|strong="H0325"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*,\f + \fr 1.10 \ft chamberlains: or, eunuchs\f*

To \w bring|strong="H0935"\w* \w Vashti|strong="H2060"\w* the \w queen|strong="H4436"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* with the \w crown|strong="H3804"\w* \w royal|strong="H4438"\w*, to \w shew|strong="H7200"\w* the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* and the \w princes|strong="H8269"\w* her \w beauty|strong="H3308"\w*: for she \add was\add* \w fair|strong="H2896"\w* to look \w on|strong="H4758"\w*.\f + \fr 1.11 \ft fair…: Heb. good of countenance\f*

But the \w queen|strong="H4436"\w* \w Vashti|strong="H2060"\w* \w refused|strong="H3985"\w* to \w come|strong="H0935"\w* at the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w commandment|strong="H1697"\w* \w by|strong="H3027"\w* \add his\add* \w chamberlains|strong="H5631"\w*: therefore was the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w very|strong="H3966"\w* \w wroth|strong="H7107"\w*, and his \w anger|strong="H2534"\w* \w burned|strong="H1197"\w* in him.\f + \fr 1.12 \ft by his…: Heb. which was by the hand of his eunuchs\f*

¶ Then the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* to the wise \w men|strong="H2450"\w*, which \w knew|strong="H3045"\w* the \w times|strong="H6256"\w*, (for so \add was\add* the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w manner|strong="H1697"\w* \w toward|strong="H6440"\w* all that \w knew|strong="H3045"\w* \w law|strong="H1881"\w* and \w judgment|strong="H1779"\w*:

And the \w next|strong="H7138"\w* unto him \add was\add* \w Carshena|strong="H3771"\w*, \w Shethar|strong="H8369"\w*, \w Admatha|strong="H0133"\w*, \w Tarshish|strong="H8659"\w*, \w Meres|strong="H4825"\w*, \w Marsena|strong="H4826"\w*, \add and\add* \w Memucan|strong="H4462"\w*, the \w seven|strong="H7651"\w* \w princes|strong="H8269"\w* of \w Persia|strong="H6539"\w* and \w Media|strong="H4074"\w*, which \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w face|strong="H6440"\w*, \add and\add* which \w sat|strong="H3427"\w* the \w first|strong="H7223"\w* in the \w kingdom|strong="H4438"\w*;)

What shall we \w do|strong="H6213"\w* unto the \w queen|strong="H4436"\w* \w Vashti|strong="H2060"\w* according to \w law|strong="H1881"\w*, because she hath not \w performed|strong="H6213"\w* the \w commandment|strong="H3982"\w* of the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w Ahasuerus|strong="H0325"\w* \w by|strong="H3027"\w* the \w chamberlains|strong="H5631"\w*?\f + \fr 1.15 \ft What…: Heb. What to do\f*

And \w Memucan|strong="H4462"\w* \w answered|strong="H0559"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* and the \w princes|strong="H8269"\w*, \w Vashti|strong="H2060"\w* the \w queen|strong="H4436"\w* hath not done \w wrong|strong="H5753"\w* to the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* only, but also to all the \w princes|strong="H8269"\w*, and to all the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* that \add are\add* in all the \w provinces|strong="H4082"\w* of the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w Ahasuerus|strong="H0325"\w*.

For \add this\add* \w deed|strong="H1697"\w* of the \w queen|strong="H4436"\w* shall come \w abroad|strong="H3318"\w* unto all \w women|strong="H0802"\w*, so that they shall \w despise|strong="H0959"\w* their \w husbands|strong="H1167"\w* in their \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w*, when it shall be \w reported|strong="H0559"\w*, The \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w Ahasuerus|strong="H0325"\w* \w commanded|strong="H0559"\w* \w Vashti|strong="H2060"\w* the \w queen|strong="H4436"\w* to be brought \w in|strong="H0935"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* him, but she \w came|strong="H0935"\w* not.

\add Likewise\add* shall the \w ladies|strong="H8282"\w* of \w Persia|strong="H6539"\w* and \w Media|strong="H4074"\w* \w say|strong="H0559"\w* this \w day|strong="H3117"\w* unto all the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w princes|strong="H8269"\w*, which have \w heard|strong="H8085"\w* of the \w deed|strong="H1697"\w* of the \w queen|strong="H4436"\w*. Thus \add shall there arise\add* too \w much|strong="H1767"\w* \w contempt|strong="H0963"\w* and \w wrath|strong="H7110"\w*.

If it \w please|strong="H2895"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, let there \w go|strong="H3318"\w* a \w royal|strong="H4438"\w* \w commandment|strong="H1697"\w* from \w him|strong="H6440"\w*, and let it be \w written|strong="H3789"\w* among the \w laws|strong="H1881"\w* of the \w Persians|strong="H6539"\w* and the \w Medes|strong="H4074"\w*, that it be not \w altered|strong="H5674"\w*, That \w Vashti|strong="H2060"\w* \w come|strong="H0935"\w* no more \w before|strong="H6440"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w Ahasuerus|strong="H0325"\w*; and let the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w give|strong="H5414"\w* her royal \w estate|strong="H4438"\w* unto \w another|strong="H7468"\w* that is \w better|strong="H2896"\w* than she.\f + \fr 1.19 \ft If it…: Heb. If it be good with the king\f*\f + \fr 1.19 \ft unto…: Heb. unto her companion\f*\f + \fr 1.19 \ft from him: Heb. from before him\f*\f + \fr 1.19 \ft be not…: Heb. pass not away\f*

And when the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w decree|strong="H6599"\w* which he shall \w make|strong="H6213"\w* shall be \w published|strong="H8085"\w* throughout all his \w empire|strong="H4438"\w*, (for it is \w great|strong="H7227"\w*,) all the \w wives|strong="H0802"\w* shall \w give|strong="H5414"\w* to their \w husbands|strong="H1167"\w* \w honour|strong="H3366"\w*, both to \w great|strong="H1419"\w* and \w small|strong="H6996"\w*.

And the \w saying|strong="H1697"\w* \w pleased|strong="H3190"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* and the \w princes|strong="H8269"\w*; and the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w did|strong="H6213"\w* according to the \w word|strong="H1697"\w* of \w Memucan|strong="H4462"\w*:\f + \fr 1.21 \ft pleased…: Heb. was good in the eyes of the king\f*

For he \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* \w letters|strong="H5612"\w* into all the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w provinces|strong="H4082"\w*, into every \w province|strong="H4082"\w* according to the \w writing|strong="H3791"\w* thereof, and to every \w people|strong="H5971"\w* after their \w language|strong="H3956"\w*, that every \w man|strong="H0376"\w* should bear \w rule|strong="H8323"\w* in his own \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, and that \add it\add* should be \w published|strong="H1696"\w* according to the \w language|strong="H3956"\w* of every \w people|strong="H5971"\w*.\f + \fr 1.22 \ft that it…: Heb. that one should publish it according to the language of his people\f*
